Actually, it's just a more aggressive and blander looking T.Rex who can camouflage.
topics.author: 554d477e63687270dee30600

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e7cd46368724ba000024d#post_559e7cd46368724ba000024d
Oh, also, for all of you guys complaining about the feathers, they actually _did_ allude to it in the movie. [spoiler]Indomius rex has quills all along its spine, foreshadowing that it had part raptor DNA.[/spoiler]
topics.author: 5201b5c0a4c72d0d9b0001e4

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e7d5463687262b600365f#post_559e7d5463687262b600365f
Funny thing is the one animal that shares the most similarities in it's DNA with the long extinct DNA is the chicken.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@toxicrystal":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e7db4636872779d001562#post_559e7db4636872779d001562
That's some really cool foreshadowing. Still, I have to wonder about the logic behind the I.Rex. So they blended T.Rex DNA, [spoiler]raptor DNA, chameleon DNA and even human DNA[/spoiler] into a poor man's T.Rex. How did they not know it was going to fail? And I'm saying this as someone who liked Jurassic World.
topics.author: 554d477e63687270dee30600

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e7ea6636872779d0016c5#post_559e7ea6636872779d0016c5
Because they only thought about if they could, and not if they should.
topics.author: 5201b5c0a4c72d0d9b0001e4

topics.body:
"@toxicrystal":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e7f3f636872798b00000f#post_559e7f3f636872798b00000f
One of those instances where one is both smart and an idiot at the same time.

And another thing, I know Hoskins is dumb, but I can't believe he's stupid enough to [spoiler]militarize raptors.[/spoiler] Every Metal Gear villain would go on and on about how dumb that plan is, and why it's gonna fail.

topics.body: Given that Velociraptors are very intelligent, use a form of communication, and are pack hunters(meaning that it will see any member of its own pack as a friend), the depiction of trained raptors aren't as far fetched as one would think. Quite similar to what ancient humans did to wolves.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559e80d5636872792e00031e#post_559e80d5636872792e00031e
Remember kids. [spoiler]If people keep going on about how you can't control it, you see you can't control it, just try to control it.[/spoiler]

It will end well.
